name: luteal
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the part of a woman's monthly menstrual cycle after she has ovulated (= produced an egg), when her body produces a hormone that is important if she becomes pregnant: The luteal phase begins after ovulation and ends when you get your next period. In this condition, the ovaries do not produce enough luteal hormone.
More examplesFewer examplesA short luteal phase is associated with difficulty conceiving.This is when a woman enters the "luteal" phase when the body gears itself up for pregnancy and produces the hormone progesterone.With suppression of ovulation, the luteal body is not formed and does not produce progesterone.The cells were recovered from ovaries in various reproductive states (anestrous, follicular or luteal).
